member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Chart
member.summary: Chart control.

remarks.para: Note: The Chart class came from the AForge.NET Framework, from a time when better charting solutions were not really available for the .NET Framework. This class is mainly intended to support applications that had already been written using AForge.NET and that would benefit from porting over to Accord.NET.
At this time, if you need support for advanced charts in your application, it is recommended to use a more complete charting solution for .NET such as ZedGraph or Microsoft's own charting controls.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType
member.summary: Chart series type enumeration.

member.summary: Line style.

member.name: F:Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType.Dots
member.summary: Dots style.

member.name: F:Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType.ConnectedDots
member.summary: Connected dots style.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Chart.RangeX
member.summary: Chart's X range.

remarks.para: The value sets the X range of data to be displayed on the chart.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Chart.RangeY
member.summary: Chart's Y range.
member.remarks: The value sets the Y range of data to be displayed on the chart.

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the object.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.AddDataSeries(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add data series to the chart.
member.param: Data series name.
Data series color.
Data series type.
Width (depends on the data series type, see remarks).

remarks.para: Adds new empty data series to the collection of data series. To update this series the method should be used.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.AddDataSeries(System.String,System.Drawing.Color,Accord.Controls.Chart.SeriesType,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add data series to the chart.
member.param: Data series name.
Data series color.
Data series type.
Width (depends on the data series type, see remarks).
Specifies if should be updated.

remarks.para: Adds new empty data series to the collection of data series.

The updateYRange parameter specifies if the data series may affect displayable Y range. If the value is set to false, then displayable Y range is not updated, but used the range, which was specified by user (see property). In the case if the value is set to true, the displayable Y range is recalculated to fully fit the new data series.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.UpdateDataSeries(System.String,System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Update data series on the chart.
member.param: Data series name to update.
Data series values.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.RemoveDataSeries(System.String)
member.summary: Remove data series from the chart.
member.param: Data series name to remove.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.RemoveAllDataSeries
member.summary: Remove all data series from the chart.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Chart.UpdateYRange
member.summary: Update Y range.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Joystick
member.summary: The class provides simple API for enumerating available joysticks and checking their current status.

remarks.para: The class provides simple access to joysticks (game controllers) through using Win32 API, which allows to enumerate available devices and query their status (state of all buttons, axes, etc).

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Info
member.summary: Information about initialized joystick.

remarks.para: The property keeps information about joystick, which was initialized using method. If no joystick was initialized, then accessing this property will generate exception.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Joystick.DeviceInfo
member.summary: Information about joystick connected to the system.

member.name: F:Accord.Controls.Joystick.DeviceInfo.ID
member.summary: Joystick ID, [0..15].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.DeviceInfo.Name
member.summary: Joystick name.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.DeviceInfo.Axes
member.summary: Number of joystick axes.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.DeviceInfo.Buttons
member.summary: Number of joystick buttons.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Joystick.GetAvailableDevices
member.summary: Get list of available joysticks connected to the system.
member.returns: Returns list containing information about available joysticks connected to the system.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Joystick.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor does not make initialization of any joystick device, so method should be used before querying joystick status or properties.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Joystick.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Joystick ID to initialize, [0, 15].

remarks.para: This constructor initializes joystick with specified ID using method, so the object becomes ready for querying joystick's status.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Init(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize joystick with the specified ID.
member.param: Joystick's ID to initialize, [0, 15].
member.exception: Invalid joystick ID was specified. It must be in [0, 15] range.
The requested joystick is not connected to the system.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Joystick.GetCurrentStatus
member.summary: Get joystick's status.
member.returns: Returns current status of initialized joystick, which provides information about current state of all axes, buttons and point of view.

para.note: Before using this method the joystick object needs to be initialized using method or constructor.

member.exception: The requested joystick is not connected to the system.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status
member.summary: Class describing current joystick's status.

para.note: All joystick axes' positions are measured in [-1, 1] range, where 0 corresponds to center position - axis is not deflected (directed) to any side.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.XAxis
member.summary: Position of X axis, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.YAxis
member.summary: Position of Y axis, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.ZAxis
member.summary: Position of Z axis, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.RAxis
member.summary: Position of R axis - 4th joystick's axes, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.UAxis
member.summary: Position of U axis - 5th joystick's axes, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.VAxis
member.summary: Position of V axis - 6th joystick's axes, [-1, 1].

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.Buttons
member.summary: Joystick buttons' state.

member.name: P:Accord.Controls.Joystick.Status.PointOfView
member.summary: Current point of view state, [0, 359].

member.summary: Check if certain button (or combination of buttons) is pressed.
member.param: Button to check state of.
member.returns: Returns if the specified button is pressed or otherwise.

member.summary: Makes a list of all the models contained on a ModelCombinator. This function is recursive.
member.param: ModelCombinator model in which to extract all the models.
List of already extracted models. It accumulates all the models at each call of this function.
member.returns: Returns a list of all the models contained in the ModelCombinator 'model' plus all previously extracted models

member.remarks: This function assumes that the models have already been calculated.

member.name: T:Accord.Controls.Extensions
member.summary: Extension methods for Windows Forms' controls.

member.name: M:Accord.Controls.Extensions.AllowNestedProperties(System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables the display of recursively nested properties in the Windows.Forms' DataGridView control.
member.param: The to enable nested properties.
True to use nested properties, false otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method will register a custom cell formatting event in the DataGridView and retrieve any nested property specified in the column's DataPropertyName property using reflection. This method is based on th idea by Antonio Bello, originally shared in:
http://www.developer-corner.com/2007/07/datagridview-how-to-bind-nested-objects_18.html
